title: Configuring Rate Rountines and Parameter Sets
sourceFile: Configuring Rate Rountines and Parameter Sets.pptx

slides.ocrText: Configuring Rate Routines and Parameter Sets

Lesson |
objectives * Configure parameter sets to provide data to

the rate routines

¢ Configure rate routines to calculate costs

¢ Configure the rate routine plugins to process
the rate routines.

slides.originalNotes:
Review: Rating architecture
The diagram shows the major components involved in the rating process using Guidewire Rating Management. A Rate book consists of data from the rate tables and rate routines. The rate routines use the parameter sets which provides the data needed for calculations in the rating algorithm. The line specific rating engine class creates the CostData objects in memory, looks up the rate factors from the rate books, populates the parameter set map to be passed in to the rate routines and executes the rate routines to store the calculated amount in the CostData objects temporarily. Eventually the rating engine merges the CostData objects to create the Cost entities, which are persisted in the database- The details about the rate books, rate tables, rate routines and parameter sets at the IJI level are covered in the PolicyCenter Rating Introduction course.
slides.notes:
Review: Rating architecture
The diagram shows the major components involved in the rating process using Guidewire Rating Management. A Rate book consists of data from the rate tables and rate routines. The line specific rating engine class creates the CostData objects in memory, looks up the rate factors from the rate books, populates the parameter set map to be passed in to the rate routines and executes the rate routines to store the calculated amount in the CostData objects temporarily. Eventually the rating engine merges the CostData objects to create the Cost entities, which are persisted in the database- The details about the rate books, rate tables, rate routines and parameter sets at the IJI level are covered in the PolicyCenter Rating Introduction course.

Review: Parameter set
The details of managing the parameter sets at the IJI level are covered in the Rating Introduction course- This lesson will focus on the Gosu code related configuration.

Review: Parameter set
The details of managing the parameter sets at the IJI level are covered in the Rating Introduction course- This lesson will focus on the Gosu code related configuration.
slides.ocrText:
| Review: Parameter set Gi

Aset of policy-related objects that provide data to the rate routines for calculations
Defined in the PolicyCenter application
Populated by the rating engine at run time

Users can define new parameters and add to the parameter sets used by the rate
routines that have not yet been added to a rate book

| Configure a new parameter

¢ Define a new parameter in Gosu
« Add a new parameter name in CalcRoutineParamName.ttx

* Define the default parameter type in
RatingParameterSetScreenHelper.mapFromCodeToType() (optional) or later in UI

¢ Add the parameter to a parameter set in the application
« Make the parameter writable (optional)
« Writable parameters can be edited in a rate routine
« Writable parameters are available in the Instruction field in a rate routine

« Non-writable parameters are available in the Operand field only

slides.originalNotes:
Populate parameter map in the rating engine
Define a new parameter map with the objects that you need to pass into the rate routine that is going to use this parameter set. The PolicyLine mapping must be included and cannot be omitted. The type of each param# object must be compatible with the Type field specified on the Parameter Sets page (on its Parameters card) for the corresponding typecode,  TC_VEHICLE must map to a vehicle object
slides.notes:
Populate parameter map in the rating engine
Define a new parameter map with the objects that you need to pass into the rate routine that is going to use this parameter set. The PolicyLine mapping must be included and cannot be omitted. The type of each param# object must be compatible with the Type field specified on the Parameter Sets page (on its Parameters card) for the corresponding typecode,  TC_VEHICLE must map to a vehicle object
slides.ocrText:
| Populate parameter map in the rating engine Gi
var rateRoutineParameterMap : Map<CalcRoutineParamName, Object > =
{TC_POLICYLINE -> PolicyLine,

typecode1 -> param,
typecode2 -> param2, ...}

where
typecode#: a typecode for the parameter from CalcRoutineParamName typelist

param#: — the policy object to map to the parameter (e.g., driver, vehicle, etc.)

| Review: Rate routine Gi

A predefined algorithm to calculate a policy cost
« Uses the policy objects in a parameter set
* Looks up the rate table values

Defined in the PolicyCenter application

Executed by the rating engine at run time

Generic or line-specific methods can be configured for use in the rate routine steps

slides.originalNotes:
Rate book selection
The rating engine must select a rate book in order to find and execute the rate routine. Rate book selection process is different for the PA and CP lines of business in the default configuratiom This is dependent upon the objects on the policy- For Personal Auto line of business, rate book is selected once because the personal lines are rated with the same ratebook throughout the policy term. For Commercial Property line of business, the rate book is selected in slice mode for each building on every location based on the date the building was added to the policy and then once for window mode calculations of taxes.
slides.notes:
Rate book selection
The rating engine must select a rate book in order to find and execute the rate routine. Rate book selection process is different for the PA and CP lines of business in the default configuratiom This is dependent upon the objects on the policy- For Personal Auto line of business, rate book is selected once because the personal lines are rated with the same ratebook throughout the policy term. For Commercial Property line of business, the rate book is selected in slice mode for each building on every location based on the date the building was added to the policy and then once for window mode calculations of taxes.
slides.ocrText:
| Rate book selection Gi

« Rate book selection process can be configured in the rating engine depending on
carrier requirements

« Examples

¢ For PA policies, rate book is selected once

* For CP, rate book is selected for each coverable (building) in slice mode and then once in
window mode

slides.originalNotes:
Method to execute a rate routine
New rate routines can be defined in the user interface. But a configuration developer must configure the rating engine class to execute the new rate routines- The parameters required by a rate routine for calculations are passed in by the rating engine. The CostData object that contains the fields available in the Instruction and Operand fields is also passed in by the rating engine.
slides.notes:
Method to execute a rate routine
New rate routines can be defined in the user interface. But a configuration developer must configure the rating engine class to execute the new rate routines- The parameters required by a rate routine for calculations are passed in by the rating engine. The CostData object that contains the fields available in the Instruction and Operand fields is also passed in by the rating engine.
slides.ocrText:
| Method to execute a rate routine Gi

RateBook.executeCalcRoutine (code : String,
costData : CostData<Cost, PolicyLine>,
worksheetContainer: WorksheetEntryContainer,
paramSet: Map<CalRoutineParamName, Object>)

where
code: the rate routine code that uniquely identifies the rate routine
costData: the CostData object which contains the properties used to calculate rate
worksheetContainer: holds information for the rating worksheets

paramSet: the parameter map representing the parameter set for the rate routine

slides.originalNotes:
Functions for the rate routines
For example. ShareRatingFunctions.min() method is called in the rateroutine "PA Coverage Premium Alogrithm" for Personal Auto- PARatingFunctions-gs contains methods available to rate routines for Personal Auto line only.
slides.notes:
Functions for the rate routines
For example. ShareRatingFunctions.min() method is called in the rateroutine "PA Coverage Premium Alogrithm" for Personal Auto- PARatingFunctions-gs contains methods available to rate routines for Personal Auto line only.
slides.ocrText:
| Functions for the rate routines Gi

¢ Generic functions for all rate routines
¢ Defined in gw.rating.flow.util. SharedRatingFunctions.gs
¢ Line-specific functions
¢ Defined in <LOB>RatingFunctions which extends RatingFunctionSource
* Available to the rate routines via the Functions menu of the Operand field in the Ul

* Override the availableForLine() method to set availability

| Steps to configure the rate routines

Define new parameters if needed

Define the parameter set in the PolicyCenter application
Edit/write a rate routine in the application

Execute the rate routine in the <LOB>RatingEngine class

* Prepare data to be passed in, such as the parameter map and CostData object

slides.originalNotes:
Rate routine plugin
The IRateRoutineP/ugin plugin is implemented in the RateRoutinePlugin class. The plugin registry entry must specify the parameter WorksheetsEnab/ed and provide a value for it If rating worksheet is enabled for a line of business, the UShow Rating Worksheet’ button appears on the Quote screen.  For more details on implementing rate routine plugin, refer to the PolicyCenter Configuration Guide.
slides.notes:
Rate routine plugin
The IRateRoutineP/ugin plugin is implemented in the RateRoutinePlugin class. The plugin registry entry must specify the parameter WorksheetsEnab/ed and provide a value for it If rating worksheet is enabled for a line of business, the UShow Rating Worksheet’ button appears on the Quote screen.  For more details on implementing rate routine plugin, refer to the PolicyCenter Configuration Guide.

+ Makes the “Show Rating Worksheet” button appear on the quote page

slides.originalNotes:
Rate routine plugin classes
Configuration developers can implement other version of the IRateRoutineplugin to customize the rate routine plugin logic only if you need custom behavior associated with generic parameter sets- Configuration related to a particular LOB should go to the line specific RateRoutineConfig class. Look at the PARateRoutineConfig and CPRateRoutineConfig classes in the default configuration. <LOB>RateRoutineConfi g classes contain methods that set up CostData wrappers for the rate routines to use- These wrappers are used to define which properties on the cost appear when you select an instruction or operand in a rate routine step- The config class must implement the getCostData WrapperTyp e and make CostDataWrapper methods 


The IRateRoutineP/ugin.gwp has settings that enable the rating worksheets for all line of businesses- The line specific rateroutine config class can disable or enable the rating worksheet for the line (for example,  PARateRoutineConfig-gs

slides.originalNotes:
Generate the rating worksheet
The rating worksheets have been configured for the Personal Auto and Commercial Properties line of businesses in the default configuration. You can edit the method getWorksheetRootNode()  or add new methods to the PAPolicyLineMethods or CPPo/icyLineMethods classes.  To configure rating worksheets for other LOBS,  you can edit the <LOB>PolicyLineMethods class for the line of business. You need to organize the objects on the policy line in a tree-like structure as shown in the getWorksheetRootNode()  method of the PAPolicyLineMethods and CPPolicyLineMethods classes.
slides.notes:
Generate the rating worksheet
The rating worksheets have been configured for the Personal Auto and Commercial Properties line of businesses in the default configuration. You can edit the method getWorksheetRootNode()  or add new methods to the PAPolicyLineMethods or CPPo/icyLineMethods classes.  To configure rating worksheets for other LOBS,  you can edit the <LOB>PolicyLineMethods class for the line of business. You need to organize the objects on the policy line in a tree-like structure as shown in the getWorksheetRootNode()  method of the PAPolicyLineMethods and CPPolicyLineMethods classes.
